text: Just realized we can use this to store data about our coffee making/drinking habits (when, how much, etc). Not sure if we will find any patterns but it would be cool to plot a couple of charts and see what we get.

so on 10.1.10.232 in directory ~/wiringPi/example there is a isr.c program
compiles w/o error. going to give to gaston to verify functionality.
coffee maker is ungrounded making probing difficult

ok rigged up a logic level converter. the output voltage is something like 2vdc which is more than enough to drive a 2n2222 transistor into saturation. when it rises the collector and emitter will close so I'll rig those up to 3.3vdc and ground on the raspberry pi.
should have something to test here pretty soon if the interrupt code is ready too
